Start with vibrant Munich, where you’ll savour culinary delights at bustling markets, delve into the history of Bavarian brewing, and even master the art of pretzel making. Next escape to the fairytale landscapes of Neuschwanstein Castle and the majestic Zugspitze peak. Then explore charming historical villages like Oberammergau, discover the serene beauty of Lake Constance, and immerse yourself in the spa town elegance of Baden-Baden. This itinerary can be tailor-made, with the number of days, places visited, and activities varied to suit you. Summary Duration 10 Days / 9 Nights from NZD $17,605* Countries Germany Type of Journey Culinary Departure Dates Daily, year-round What's Included Tour Includes Tailor-made journey 9-nights accommodation 9 breakfasts Meet & Greet at Munich International Airport Private arrival transfer on Day 1 and departure transfer on Day 10 English-speaking local guides English-speaking driver/guide Day 4-9 Private sightseeing as per the itinerary Private food or beer walking tour Private pretzel making workshop Entrance fees as per the itinerary Not Included City hotel tax (if applicable) Gratuities Pricing Description Twin NZD Single NZD Extra NZD 2025 4-star 1 Jan – 31 Dec – – 17605 – – 33935 Please note: while prices are accurate at time of loading they are subject to change due to currency fluctuations and currency surcharges may apply. Please check price at time of booking Itinerary Day 1 : Munich Upon arrival you will be met and transferred to your hotel. Enjoy the rest of your day at leisure to relax or explore the city on your own. Day 2 : Munich Today you will embark on a culinary tour of your choice (two options). Opt for a culinary tour at Munich’s famous markets (viktualienmarkt), where you will get a taste of Bavaria while learning about local history and the vibrant culture and flavours of popular sites in Munich. Or perhaps take an immersive beer tour with a visit to the Beer and Oktoberfest Museum to learn about the rich history of Bavaria’s brewing traditions, followed by a visit of the Hofbräuhaus, offering a unique glimpse into one of Munich’s most famous beer halls. Day 3 : Munich Enjoy the morning at leisure. In the afternoon you will experience a baking workshop with a renowned local baker and learn to make traditional pretzels. The workshop ends with the tasting of the freshly baked pretzels served with butter. Day 4 : Munich > Garmisch-Partenkirchen > Fuessen Today your adventure through the scenic southwest of Germany begins as your private driver-guide waits for you in the hotel lobby. Along the way, your driver-guide will give information and share insights of the region. Head southwest towards the stunning Bavarian Alps, with a stop in Garmisch-Partenkirchen, the famous ski resort town nestled at the foot of the mountains. Take the cable car up to the top of Zugspitze, Germany’s highest peak, offering spectacular panoramic views of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. Continue your journey to Fuessen, set amid beautiful Alpine scenery. Day 5 : Fuessen > Neuschwanstein > Oberammergau > Fuessen Today, step into the fairytale world of Neuschwanstein Castle, the iconic masterpiece of King Ludwig II. This world-famous castle inspired Walt Disney’s Sleeping Beauty Castle and is known for its lavish interiors and breathtaking views. Next, visit Linderhof Palace, another of Ludwig II’s residences, known for its beautiful gardens and intricate Rococo design. The day continues with a stop in Oberammergau, a charming village renowned for its beautifully painted frescoed houses and its world-famous Passion Play, held every 10 years. Return to your hotel for a relaxing evening. Day 6 : Fuessen > Lake Constance > Titisee, Black Forest Today you will leave Fuessen behind as you journey westward towards the enchanting Black Forest. En route, stop in the lovely town of Lindau, located on an island in the shimmering waters of Lake Constance. A short guided walk through the town reveals its medieval architecture, including the harbour’s famous lighthouse and Bavarian Lion statue. After enjoying Lindau’s lakeside charm, continue to your hotel near the serene Titisee Lake. Day 7 : Titisee > Freiburg, Black Forest > Titisee Today, explore the vibrant city of Freiburg, famous for its medieval old town and stunning Freiburg Minster, an impressive Gothic cathedral with one of the tallest spires in Europe. Your driver-guide will take you on a short walking tour through its charming cobbled streets, past the colourful Münsterplatz market square and historical landmarks like the Schwabentor and Martinstor city gates. After soaking in the local history and culture, return to your hotel. Day 8 : Titisee > Baden-Baden, Black Forest Embark on a scenic journey through the Black Forest, starting at the serene Lake Titisee and ending in the charming spa town of Baden-Baden. As you travel through this picturesque region, there are opportunities to visit some of the Black Forest’s most iconic sights, such as the stunning Triberg Waterfalls, the worlds largest cuckoo clock and the Vogtsbauernhof Open-Air Museum, where you can explore historic farmhouses. You might also stop at quaint villages, sample local specialties like Black Forest cake, or enjoy scenic viewpoints along the way. The tour concludes in Baden-Baden, known for its thermal baths and elegant atmosphere. Day 9 : Baden-Baden > Heidelberg > Frankfurt Today travel to Heidelberg, one of Germany’s most romantic and historically rich cities. Take a guided walk through its picturesque old town, home to the impressive Heidelberg University, the oldest in Germany, and the scenic Philosophers’ Walk along the Neckar River. Visit the majestic Heidelberg Castle, a partially-ruined Renaissance fortress overlooking the city, and learn about its storied past. In the afternoon, continue to Frankfurt for your overnight. Day 10 : Frankfurt After breakfast you will be transferred to Frankfurt Airport where arrangements conclude. Type of Journey: Booking Conditions This tour is also available as a self-drive, please enquire about pricing Surcharges apply for the Christmas & New Year’s period Surcharges may also apply during festivals and National/religious holidays The food walking tour is available from May to September The beer walking tour is available from October to April Sights visited in the Black Forest may vary by day/season Please also enquire to add nights and sightseeing in Frankfurt This tour is also available from Frankfurt > Munich More Deals Enquire HLO Ref# 29895 More Tours All Tour deals South Pacific Australia Escorted New Zealand Asia UK & Europe - Contiki - Europe - Costsaver - Europe - England - Europe - Greece - Insight Vacations - Europe - Intrepid - Europe - Ireland - Luxury Gold - UK & Europe - Scotland - Trafalgar Tours - Europe - Wales - World Journeys - Europe North America South America Africa Antarctica Central America Latin America Luxury Rail Middle East Sports and Events Weddings & Honeymoons Subscribe to get special offers: This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.
